danish_publication: Jörgen Birkebæk knappede blot den øverste del af hans vest, og folk fortalte om ham, at han havde gjort akkord med den Slemme, og han måtte komme og tage ham, når han blev færdig, men på den måde blev han aldrig færdig med at trække i klæderne. Han var en sær tvær én til at svare. Én spurgte: "Hvordan er dit boget i år, Jörgen?" — "Trekantet." — "Jamen hvad giver det af sig?" — "Så meget, som vi tærsker af det." På Kollemorten marked skulde han sælge en stud. "Hvad holder du den stud i?" — "I reb." — "Jamen hvor meget vil du have for den?" — "Penge." — "Ja, hvor mange?" — "Så mange, som vi kan komme til rette om."
english_publication: Jørgen Birkebæk only buttoned the top part of his vest, and people said that he had made a pact with the Evil One that he could come and take him when he'd finished dressing but, because of that, he never finished putting on his clothes. He was a hard one to get a straight answer from. "How is your buckwheat this year, Jørgen?" -- "Triangular." -- "What does that give you?" -- "As much as we thresh from it." He was supposed to sell a steer at Kollemorten market. "What did you feed it [What did you hold it with]?" -- "Rope." -- "But what do you want for it?" -- "Money." -- "Sure, but how much?" -- "As much as we can agree on."

etk_index.heading_danish: Om Fanden og forbund med ham
etk_index.heading_english: About the Devil and being in league with the Devil
